intro: Acineta superba var. chrysantha, commonly known as the golden acineta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and arid landscapes.
